text: treville , " added the king , in a low voice , as the others were retiring , " as you have no room in the musketeers , and as we have besides decided that a novitiate is necessary before entering that corps , place this young man in the company of the guards of monsieur dessessart , your brother - in - law .
the two guardsmen courteously accepted d’artagnan ’s excuses , and perceiving that the four friends desired to be alone , retired .
there are many stories related of him , and among them this . after a wild youth , he had retired into a convent , there to expiate , at least for some time , the follies of adolescence .
at the same hour as on the preceding evening , d’artagnan retired .

the reporter retired into a dark corner after having shortly noted down the occurrences of the day ; the first appearance of this new land , the loss of their leader , the exploration of the coast , the incident of the matches , etc . ; and then overcome by fatigue , he managed to forget his sorrows in sleep .
adele seemed scarcely to need the warning -- she had already retired to a sofa with her treasure , and was busy untying the cord which secured the lid .
the chancellor , who , on his part , trembled with an emotion easily to be conceived , took the letter , bowed to the ground , and retired .

possessed by one single thought -- that of the promise he had made , and of the responsibility he had taken -- he retired last to his chamber , begged the host to procure him a map of the province , bent over it , examined every line traced upon it , perceived that there were four different roads from bethune to armentieres , and summoned the lackeys .
but no one entered except two or three marines , who brought her trunks and packages , deposited them in a corner , and retired without speaking .
these arrangements made , the lackeys retired .

the poor fowl was thin , and covered with one of those thick , bristly skins through which the teeth can not penetrate with all their efforts . the fowl must have been sought for a long time on the perch , to which it had retired to die of old age .
each retired to his own apartment .
the usher introduced him , and retired without speaking a word .
and planchet retired , shaking his head with an air of doubt , which the liberality of d’artagnan had not entirely effaced .
the engineer 's companions , respecting the wish , retired .

their meal concluded , each retired to the corner in which he had rested the preceding night , and herbert was not long in going to sleep near the sailor , who had stretched himself beside the fireplace .
he had retired at one o’clock under the pretense of being indisposed .
m bonacieux was introduced afresh , and upon a sign from the cardinal , the officer retired .
the comte de rochefort bowed like a man who acknowledges the superiority of the master as great , and retired .
then m. de treville made a sign with his hand , and all retired except d’artagnan , who did not forget that he had an audience , and with the tenacity of a gascon remained in his place .
rochefort obeyed and retired .
he then retired , and closed the door .
" at these words he retired . i heard the door open and shut , and i remained overwhelmed , less , i confess it , by my grief than by the mortification of not having avenged myself .
felton made no reply , took the book with the same appearance of repugnance which he had before manifested , and retired pensively .
and lord de winter retired swearing , which at that period was a very knightly habit .
